Ajoutez l'ail écrasé, le concentré de tomate, la sauce tomate, la viande hachée et pressez bien le tout.

Laissez mijoter 30 min à feu doux.

10 minutes avant la fin, faites cuire les pâtes al dente.

Egouttez-les pâtes, mélangez-les avec un peu de beurre.

ÉTAPE 10
Retirez le laurier de la sauce, versez-la sur les pâtes.

Parsemez de parmesan et servez.

review:
Don't expect deep content here. It's mostly just a simple water taxi game set in the tropics, but it does a good job in that niche. The water and sights are pretty, the sounds pleasant, the gameplay is easy, and if you know how to drive a boat, the controls are fine. For the price, it's a fun little time waster.

I assume many of the people complaining about controls are not familiar with how boats behave, and so have trouble with the inertia management required when you don't have brakes like in a car. The controls themselves are stupid simple: "A" to increase forward throttle, "S" for decrease/reverse, "A/D" for steering.

author: {'steamid': '76561198357521747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1963, 'last_played': 1710306449}
review:
Крутая игруха, где ты плаваешь на лодке и развозишь отдыхающих по пляжам и прибрежным отелям. Цель игры - скупить всю туристическую инфраструктуру и все лодки: выжить всех девять конкурентов с данного курортного-архипелага экономическими методами. Войны тут нет, кроме пиратов, ходить не получится (ни по палубе, ни по пирсу или далее). От пирата нужно также уезжать, как и от торнадо.

Как и в любой транспортной игре, тут нельзя выйти из лодки. Но можно закупаться всем (кроме топлива) и чиниться прямо в движении. По ходу движения, игра предлагает квесты (игра в игре):
 - спасение потерпевших крушение;
 - рыбалка;
 - поиск монет на дне;
 - фотографирование .
Туристы не только изъявляют желание переправиться на другой пирс (в другой отель/бунгало), но и бывают просят поискать что-то ценное на дне - отправляют вас в экспедицию.

Игра может неожиданно закончиться на раннем этапе, если вы потратились в "0" и не смогли расплатиться за место в порту (марине) или за товар (топливо, предметы для туристов, воздух для дайвинга). Единственно за что вас игра простит (и позволит продолжить игру) - это за ремонт, который не полностью был выполнен по причине обнуления вашего кошелька. Также иногда возникают торнадо в игре и если оно успеет полностью разрушить вашу лодку (до того как вы от него уедете), то также игра закончится. И тут не важно сколько у вас собственности уже накопилось: если ваша лодка разрушилась на 100%, то вам не дадут её починить, и если вы полностью выбрали кэш не позволят дождаться ренты (кредитования нет в игре).

То есть, в игре присутствуют пираты и торнадо, которые будут разрушать постепенно вашу лодку пока вы от них не уедете, но только пиратов карта показывает. Торнадо - так же как и пираты не перемещаются а находятся в определённых местах карты, но эти места придётся запомнить. Также нужно следить за дном и берегом, так как наезды на них повреждают лодку, как и нужно аккуратно парковаться. Бунгало (на сваях), пирс и другие лодки возле него - неразрушаемы, в отличие от вашей посудины.

ОСОБЕННОСТИ
(1) Сохранения в игре выполняются в виде автосохранения, и точно такого же сохранения которое вы производите по своему желанию. Последнее будет разрешено сделать только когда вы плывёте (идёте, как говорят моряки, то есть, перемещаетесь) без пассажира и без задания (без квеста, то  есть не находитесь в игре/экспедиции/перевозке, и находитесь вне марины - далеко от пирса при том). Если вы кого-то везёте, или вы в экспедиции, или вы отправились в экспедицию на поиски, то только автосохранение (одно, последнее) вам будет доступно потом (если что) для загрузки. А вот сохранений игрока может быть много.

(2) Удить рыбу стоит только если денег оказалось мало после покупки последней недвижимости, и/или лодка получила повреждения и все деньги полностью ушли на починку. Бесплатно в марину стать нельзя, нужно наудить на 500 денег для этого. Иначе - удение рыбы - длительный процесс и мизерный доход, просто потеря времени. А периодически предлагают недвигу и вы должны быть готовы к её покупке. Если не наудить на 500 денег, то при парковке у пирса - ваша игра закончится (вы не смогли оплатить марину, а стоимость разная - от 51 до 389 я видел).

(3) Дайвить можно только в месте, где вам игра это разрешает, но не рекомендую. Турист заплатит хорошие деньги за это (как за две перевозки, обычно) отправив вас в экспедицию, а самостоятельный дайвинг - в лучшем случае выйдет в ноль (если монеты на дне найдёте). Но в экспедиции - всё же рекомендую и монеты на дне собирать тоже, так как это существенно может увеличить доход от экспедиции (на 5-10% в среднем).

However, the reality is that you replace the drudgery of office work with the drudgery of maritime taxi-ing.  There's just not much game to this game, even though it had potential. review:
A jó életbe! Ez megint valami új volt. A The Good Life egy egyszerű, nem túl részletes gazdasági szimulátor, külső nézetből.

Fogalmam sincs hogy a játékban szereplő számos sziget valóban létezik-e, mindenesetre erre a varázslatos paradicsomra érkeznek meg főhőseink, egy pár, akik közül választani lehet, hogy kivel szeretnénk játszani. (Hetero párról lévén szó, férfi és nő közül.)
Mi egy vagyunk a szigetcsoporton tevékenykedő vállalkozók közül, akik vízi járművekkel és a szigeteken lévő ingatlanokkal kereskednek. Cél, hogy mi legyünk a legnagyobb hal köztük!
A megannyi szigethez kikötő tartozik, ezekbe kikötve tölthetjük fel járműveinket üzemanyaggal, és itt vásárolhatunk újakat is, motorcsónaktól a luxusyachtokig. Sajnos utóbbit elég nehéz manőverezni a kisebb kikötőkben, bevallom a vitorláshajót ki se próbáltam, mivel a motoros játművekkel is meggyűlt a bajom.
A pénzkereséshez sok lehetőség van, legalapvetőbb a személyszállítás, 1 fő/ út. De lehet még kutatóexpedíciókat is indítani kincsek vagy repülőgéproncsok után is, lehet horgászni, fotózni stb.
A játéknak nem erőssége a grafikai részletesség, inkább a vízfelszín megvalósítása volt szembetűnő, a hullámok fizikai hatása a hajónkra viharban teljesen valósághű.
Amit ki lehet emelni az a zene. Rendkívül nyugtató hatású muzsia szól pl búvárkodáskor, sajnálatos módon ennek a játéknak nem elérhetők külön zenefájlai a Steam Store-ból, talán azért, mert nincs belőle sok.
A játék negatívuma a kis kiötők mellett hogy fel lehet szaladni úgy a partra, hogy nem lehet visszatérni a vízbe, dacára annak hogy a program lök rajtunk egyet a víz felé, ez szinte hatásalan. Ezt meg lehetett volna máshogy oldani.

A The Good Life nem nagy kaland igazából, a kereskedés mechanikája egyszerű, ahogy a játékmenet is. A program egy gigát se nyom a merevlemezen, ami miatt ajánlott, hogy a kevés fejfájás ellenére nem találtam megkerülhetetlen bugokat, így többnyire kellemesre sikerült a kiruccanásom. Kb 25+%-os leértékelés mellett ajánlott a vásárlása.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048093799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1432575408}
review:
Im ersten Moment ganz nett aufgemacht. Grafiktechnisch nicht auf dem Stand der Zeit, aber die Spielumgebung ist hübsch anzusehen. Leider war es das dann auch schon mit Positivem.
Das Wirtschaftssystem besteht daraus, dass immerwieder für ein paar Sekunden zufällige Artikel zu zufälligen Preisen aufblinken. Diese kann man per Tastendruck kaufen. Hat man beim nächsten Zufallsauftrag einen Passagier, der genau diese Ware will (Sonnencreme, Souvenirs, Bungalow,...) und dabei mehr bezahlt, als man selbst für den Erwerb ausgegeben hat, so macht man Gewinn. Bringt der Zufallsgenerator andere Wünsche der Kunden zu Tage, war es ein Verlustgeschäft.
Es gibt Piraten die einen immer wieder überfallen wollen. Im allgemeinen entkommt man denen mit minimalen bis gar keinen Schäden. Bringt ein bisschen Spannung ins Spiel, aber nicht viel (und meiner rein persönlichen Meinung nach, passen Kampfhandlungen nicht ins Spielkonzept).
Und nun der größte Negativpunkt: Die Steuerrung. Einfach nur nach unten zu tauchen, um einem zufällig gefundenen Schatz nahe zu kommen, ist schon eine große Herausforderung. Dann auf der richtigen Tiefe angekommen einfach nur in die Richtung des Schatzes zu schwimmen grenzt an eine Unmöglichkeit. Egal welches Eingabegerät verwendet wird, das Bootefahren ist noch o.k., aber Tauchgänge machen so einfach keinen Spaß.

Fazit: Nette Idee, schöne Umgebung, wenn auch grafiktechnisch nicht mehr ganz zeitgemäß, sehr zufallsbasiertes Wirtschaftssystem, dass mit einer Wirtschaftssimulation mal so gar nichts zu tun hat und eine katastrophale Steuerung. Und wem das egal ist und der einfach nur gemütlich die Umgebung betrachten will, dem kommen dann die Piraten in die Quere.
Definitv KEINE Kaufempfehlung!

A beautiful idyllic simulation.  For the $2 spent, it was well worth it.  Those paying full price might feel a bit ripped off.

PROS:

-- Beautiful and varied ocean/island scenery
-- Restful music
-- Music changes to match tasks/environment.
-- Boat handling characteristics are realistic.
-- Boat damage scales with speed of impact.
-- The challenge of mooring the original boat is fun.

CONS:

-- Mooring challenges with highly upgraded boats (e.g., 58' yacht) are too challenging.
-- Mission challenges during fares are typically intrusive/disruptive to the experience.
-- Mission challenges in upgraded boats can be frustrating.
-- You never leave your boat.
-- Customers (fares) are a little too simplistic models.
-- The property tycoon mechanics (what is a good buy?) were not well explained.

review:
どうやら日本語のレビューがないみたいなので、少し意見を。

動画を見ていると地上を散策できそうに見えますが、そんなことは決してありません。このゲームでできることは、船に乗って人をA地点からB地点に連れて行ってあげる、これが基本線であり、また大半を占めるかと思います。一応海にもぐってお宝探し、もありますが、水中のマップは一種類しかありませんし、ダイビングポイントからしか潜水できないようになっているため、自由度は高いとはいえません。他にも釣りや沈没した船に乗っていた乗客に浮き輪を投げるといったミニゲームがありますが、きわめて単調といわざるを得ません。

そもそも経営的なことを謳っていますが、金をためる→不動産を買う、で終わりです。この不動産を買うときに競売のような形式になっていますが、一旦買うともう介入できないようになっていますし(サービスの質とかそういう概念がない)、経営感のあるゲームを求めるならばこのゲームはおそらく求めているものではないかと思います。

他の方も指摘していましたが、点Aから点Bに人を運ぶのはCrazy Taxiなどの作品もありますし、それなりの面白みはなくもないです。が、船というのは何もない水上を突っ切るのがメインで障害物を避けるといった車らしいこと、減速したりバックすることに制約があって緊張感がある航空機と違い、おそろしく平和な旅になります。製作者さん側もそれは分かっているのか、海賊にRPGを撃たれたり竜巻に遭遇したりはしますが、避けるのは簡単ですし、そもそも遭遇しないことも平和な旅も多々あります。

もっと自由度をあげれば、例えば地上を歩き回ったり、ストーリーを作ってみたり、あるいは買ったバンガローをカスタマイズしたり、できるようにすると楽しいかもしれませんが、現在の状態では人を運ぶだけ、唯一難儀するのは入港時に岸壁に衝突しないようにする、以上です。

面白くできそうですが、最後のアップデートは2014年の終わりなので、もう期待できないかなー。心情的には1野口損しましたかね。

review:
Bei The Good Life handelt es sich um eine Art Lebenssimulation, Man ist ein Mann oder eine Frau und man muss seinen Lebensunterhalt bezahlen indem man Bootstouren evranstaltet, Leute transportiert, Tauchen oder Angeln geht...

- Schöne Landschaft

Contra:
- Misserable Steuerung Das Verhalten des Schiffes ähnelt eher einer Boje und beim Schwimmen denkt man man kommt nicht vorwärts, desweiteren ist die Steuerung absolut unintuitiv
- Enthält scheinbar Teilweise noch die Debugtexte ( z.B wenn man ein Achievement erhält bekommt man ein kleines Bild und einen Text und darunter steht eine Art Variablenname
- Die Animationen sind Misserabel, z.B wenn man mit dem Boot sinkt geht das Schiff einfach unter Wasser, man sieht keinen Schaden und der Fahrer steht unter Wasser immernoch ganz normal am Steuerrad
- Umgebungsobjekte nehmen keinen Schaden, z.B wenn man mit voller Wucht an einen Holzsteg fährt oder mit seinem großen Boot gegen ein kleines fährt bekommt man zwar Schaden aber das Spiel läuft einfach weiter als wäre nichts und man sieht auch nichts ausser an der oberen Bildschirmseite eine Leiste welche auch recht ungewohnt ist da diese den Schaden nicht anhand einer sich Leerenden Leiste anzeigt sondern einer die sich füllt.
- Missionserklärungen sind mies. bekam am Anfang einen kunden der Wollte auf die andere Seite der inseln, Ich fuhr dem Questtracker nach, jedenfalls dachte ich es sei einer und kam ständig in Sackgassen. Letztendlich lies ich dann den Kunden am falschen Hafen raus obwohl ich dort hingelotst wurde (Jedenfalls vermute ich das, denn das Unserinterface ist grottig)
- Das Spiel ist zwar mit Controller steuerbar jedoch nur einzelne Teile, ständig muss man wechseln und die Steuerung mit Maus und tastatur ist noch schlimmer als die mit dem Controller

review:
I really enjoyed my time with The Good Life. I canvased the forum, read reviews and watched a few videos before I bought it on sale at 2.49. The controls take some getting used to and the boats are tad to floppy sometimes but after playing it for awhile I figured out how to catch fish, collect rent, find treasure before using up all the air and in the end I won, literally the game told me that :)

I thought this game was made by the company that did Aquadelic GT because the boats and water are very similair but its just a resemblance, Aquadelic GT had more boat sounds like water smacking the hull. At first I was not sure which property to buy and what to focus on but after playing and reading the screens that come up I started buying everything I could afford and completing all the tasks on the trips. I sold off my starter boat thinking I could buy it back or didn't need it but if you want the achievement for owning all boats keep it. I had to start over after like 12 hours because I sold all my old boats to buy property, do not do this as the boats you are not in generate income. I only had a few bugs, the first was the big sport fisherman (purple) has the steering wheel floating over the drivers head, its visible in the picture before buying it and second was the occasional treasure spot on dry land or a photograph target under a building. Otherswise the game was rock solid and I ended up somewhere around 41 on the Hall of Fame.

For 2.49 or even 9.99 you would be hard pressed to find anything this entertaining.

I would love to see a sequel to this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116953146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3395, 'last_played': 1561759296}
review:
Firstly, this is an unusual game and, looking at the forums the developers are very happy to tweak and improve.  Their obvious intent is to make it as good as it can be.  For this reason I’m recommending it.  There isn’t a lot of experimentation with genre these days and they deserve the credit for having a go and persevering.  I hope that one day my game will be better as they patch it.  And the overall feel is such that even though the gameplay is driving me to distraction I’m still trying!

However, there are some cons that are close to game breakers for me.  It feels as if it should be a happy, casual game with a few teeth to make it a bit more exciting – storms, pirates etc.  It also feels as if the random tasks you have to do while trying to get your passengers from A to B within a time frame should be fun and lift the pace a bit.

Unfortunately, as it stands at the moment playing this game is a chore purely because, despite experimenting with lots of different combinations of settings, the controls are, quite frankly, awful.  

With my basic gaming computer set up, the boat controls are fine and as they should be, as long as you realise that these are boats and not racing cars.  However the big problem is the camera and mouse controls which are fantastically erratic.

The mouse control is laggy, which means that you have to spend way too much time trying to hit a button resulting in loss of control of your boat. I have since found that if you go into your computer control panel and turn the mouse sensitivity down to the slowest you can, the situation - although not perfect - improves dramatically. The camera angles are poor.  On the face of it, as you are given 4 different camera positions, you should be able to easily see whatever you need to.  Unfortunately 2 of them have very limited use – why would I want to see inside the boat unless I’m happy to crash?  The third, I haven’t been able to find a use for and the default one, the one that you are almost constantly using, is a nightmare.   

In order to look around, you have to hold the left mouse button down and move the mouse in the direction you want to see (up, down and around).  This control varies wildly from fair, where you can see everything with very little effort; to ultra sensitive where the slightest touch leaves you looking at a scene and you have no idea where you are (please remember the boat is still moving at this point - well until the harbour wall stops it).  Alternatively you can end up looking at the bottom of the sea.  The problem here is that it seems to become ultra sensitive when you need it to behave most – such as when you’re trying to dock. Compare this with the lagginess of the mouse when you need to use it to click on things and the whole thing just doesn’t make sense.

The sensitivity is an issue when you are trying to take photographs. You find your bird.  You point your boat in the right direction and hold the right hand mouse button down.  Sadly you see a piece of blue sky with absolutely no idea where in the sky you are.  You wave your mouse about in the hope you might catch the bird.  No luck.  You go into the normal view and find the bird again – to be fair not very far from where it was initially.  Try again.  No luck.  Eventually you glimpse the tip of the wing and you realise how fast your mouse is scanning the sky – you’re hardly touching it but it’s going so fast that by the time you realise you’ve seen the tip of the wing, you’ve got no chance of backtracking and finding it again. Rinse and repeat until you luck out.  Absolutely no way can you do this when you’ve got a passenger on board.

Having said all this everything else is lovely – which is why, along with the developers, I’m persevering with it.  It’s just that this could easily become my favourite casual game and it’s frustrating to have it spoilt by the controls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049904005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1454014620}
review:
Симулятор жизни рулевого яхты с экономической составляющей. Всё действие происходит на карте с эдак 8-10 Гавайскими островами перед отдыхающими, и оно только на яхте. Русского языка нет, но все и так понятно.
   Типов миссий в игре немного: в основном это подвозить кого-либо до места (в дороге отдыхающего можно угостить чем-либо, купленным за деньги), либо искать артефакты и сокровища на дне. Есть также доп. миссии, которые время от времени встречаются в разных местах: ловля рыбы, составление фотоальбома (для чего нужно будет остановиться и фотографировать птиц на лету, дельфинов и т.д.), спасение утопающих. Все это влияет на репутацию и деньги.
    Можно покупать/продавать дома, яхты и рестораны по предложениям продающих. Можно подремонтировать или купить яхту. В игре ведется рейтинг владений олигархов и собственно игрока.
   Встретилась только один раз доп. миссия по пришвартовыванию к 4 палобному теплоходу. На этом миссии как бы заканчиваются. И в то же время при прохождении заявляют, что у вас открыты новые возможности в этой игре. Но миссий больше не становится.

    Графика воды хорошая, графика остального - приемлемая. Управление яхты неудобное чуть, управление под водой -- даже тяжелое.
    Есть ощущение, что игра недоделана. Где сюжет, в чем смысл? Сыграть можно, но ввиду повторяемости миссий она надоедает. Удивительно, но ведется процент прохождения игры, как будто у нее есть полнометражный сюжет. Но его, увы, нету.

   Сыграть можно, но за три дня надоела. Слишком мало миссий и свободы игрока что-либо делать, кроме как плавать, подвозить, фотографировать, покупать/продавать зачем-то,  ловить рыбу или дрейфовать в океане ради его живописности.

5 из 10 баллов

review:
I have only been playing four hours as I write this but I think this is a "keeper". Some people have complained about the boat controls and how hard "parking" them is. I have been around boats most of my life. They DO NOT handle like cars. You need to think ahead and this is how they are modeled in the game. Think ahead, realise you do not stop by just throttling back, and you will be berthing your boat neatly before you know it.

There have been complaints that the game sells itself as a "tycoon" type game. These may be issues that were in the older versions; I don't know about that as I have only just got the game. All I can say is that you have to make sure you have enough cash to keep your business "afloat" at all times. I learned that there is no overdraft facility by paying for my repairs, leaving me cashless. Keep a check on your bank balance!

So, do I enjoy the game? Yes. The music in the diving area is calming... For a while then I got annoyed with it, sorry bout that. :( I found that the controls for diving are harder to get a hang of than the boats. But then I have never been diving, perhaps they are fine if you have dived, bit like the boat controls maybe? :)

The pirates are a bit odd; another review says they are firing nerf darts at you. Couldn't have put it better myself. So far, even my rickity old startup taxi could avoid them so not sure, at this point, what they are there for. I may regret saying that and maybe there will be a dozen waiting for me when I play next time. I do have a very nice boat now, wouldn't want to lose it or get the green paint scratched.

It is in the sale, (should that be sail ;-) ) at the moment; buy it now!

review:
It is not such a bad game. But it is more an arcade-action and a game of skills. Every 2 to 4 trips pirats are coming into your line trying to damage your boat, every 2 to 4 trips tornados are coming into your line. For a simulation game a bit to unrealististic and very nervy. Very nervy are the camera controls, both with mouse and gamepad. The bigger your ship, more problems with controlling in side missions. I am not so happy with it. 
There could be more informations about docking stations to the map before you agree into a customer's contract. F.e. distance from current location and a list of it. An option is missing to get more passengers in one journey. 
If you run into a sandbar, don't think about to call for help. There is no option given in this game. You can load your game save by hoping that the sandbar will release you, but it depends on how deep you ran into it.
You can change your bought boats at each docking station if you like.

But I can give this one my recommendation because of the atmosphere of this game and all the skills you have to use making this one very special. All in all a nice game with interesting challenges. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197990675419', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1434245698}
review:
The Good Life is a rare type of game, fitting a very specific interest. However, for those of us with that interest, this game is a gem. The Good Life has its ups and downs, but for the most part it is a very enjoyable game, if it's what you're looking for. 

Pros :
-Huge world to explore, plenty to see and discover
-Plenty of missions
-Pretty environments
-(sometimes) fun minigames
-Awesome soundtrack
-Good Price
-New, rare genre
-Online highscore ranking
-Great to relax with

Cons:
-The diving is fun, but the camera/player is insanly hard to control
-Cheesy intro
-Random forced missions while transporting people (rescuing people, taking pictures, running from pirates)
-Sometimes you can't save, forcing to lose data or play until the option re-appears. 
-Long over-complicated 'controls' help on Main Menu
-Little interaction with anyone, it gets lonely in such a huge world

Overall, I love this game. If you can look past the downsides it's great. The game is much less 'relax vacation simulator' as I assumed, and more of a 'relaxed small business game, in a vacation area', as you rarely leave your boat/work. However, I think this game is 100% worth the effort. When it goes on sale, the price is perfect (5$). If the devs continue to support this game by fixing bugs and adding new content, this game could be nearly perfect too. Overall, 7/10.

review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NhCmI4DTr8Q

Ah, The Good Life. As you may see from this video, it looks wonderful.

First, I need Steam trading cards for this game. They're like sunken treasure. But anyway...

Imagine a world where you take enormous amounts of money from people to transport them between tropical islands in an archepelago, flogging them food and drugs along the way. Well, here it is. You are completely in charge, to the point where if you want to abandon ship halfway through transporting them to go diving for treasure, you can. You probably shouldn't, but you can.

It's the sort of nonsense I love. And it is, nonsense. If you are looking for an in-depth business or management sim, this is not it. This is for relaxing with in a moment of downtime.

And it would be relaxing, if it weren't for the tornados, pirates, and screaming drowning people. But let's not talk about them. It's too harrowing.

review: I bought this unsure if I would like it after reading mixed reviews, but after playing this for 5 hours straight I quite like this game. You are a water taxi transporting wealthy folk between a archipelago of islands. With money earned you can buy more boats and various property oppotunities that go up for sale during taxi missions. There is always things going on and happening during taxi missions which stops the game from getting boring and keeps it interesting, from pirates (which are right nasty bastards) to throwing life rings to drowning souls. The game can also be enhanced by playing the game with an erection. Its not perfect though, but has a nice balance. I like how the big boats which earn more are more difficult mooring than the small ones. All boats are available to buy at the start of the game, instead of incermentally so you can buy the best boats early on in the game whereas I would have liked to have worked on increasing my rank to get better boats. The AI players also start with a large amount of property and it will take some time on increaing your own portfolio before you are able to buy large amounts of property meaning the AI players will purchase it. The pre-set camera angles can also be awkward, but using my third hand I played this with an Xbox 360 Controller, mouse and keyboard at the same time. Even better as of writing the Dev is listening to players feedback to make improvements and releasing patches to improve the game. While the game might not be for everyone, I am more impressed than I thought I would be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118318394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1422737261}
review:
Die Steuerung und den Spielaufbau empfand ich als wenig intuitiv. Das Tutorial hat seine Schwächen. So kommt es in Form aufploppender Texte daher, was grundlegend kein Kritikpunkt ist, jedoch läuft alles andere weiter - sei es das Boot mit dem man gerade herumfährt oder aber auch die Zeit für bestimmte Aufgaben.
Das Gleiche ist der Fall, wenn z.b. ein Kaufangebot für irgendwas aufploppt. Wrklich darauf konzentrieren und abwägen ist so nur schwerlich möglich, wenn man nicht im selben Moment im Zweifelsfall irgendwo gegenn fahren oder u.U. knapp bemessene Missionszeit verlieren möchte.

Entsprechend kam ich oft nicht dazu ausführlich zu lesen habe dan per Try'n Error versucht herauszufinden,  was ich überhaupt tun soll und wie das im Detail umzusetzen ist.

Passagiere die etwas kaufen möchten, scheinen extrem ungeduldig, da deren Hinweis darauf innerhalb weniger Sekunden verschwindet und man, hat man die Had in dem Moment gerade nicht an der Maus, die Chance verpasst darauf einzugehen (mir 3x nacheinander passiert, weil ich es wagte beim Spielen zum Wasserglas zu greifen).

Ich habe versucht das Spiel zu mögen, aber nach etwa einer Stunde wurde mir klar, dass das Gameplay primär daraus besteht Passagiere per Wassertaxi von A nach B zu fahren und - sofern man daran genug verdient, auf de gelegentlich aufploppenden Kaufangebote zu reagieren.

Für meinen Geschmack deutlich zu unaufregend - entsprechend ernüchtert bin ich bezüglich The Good Life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059556836', 'num_games_owned': 2756, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1418702328}
review:
The Good Life is an alright game with a neat concept. I would describe it as a casual simu-explorer with hints of management. For a game of this caliber, the graphics are decent – I’m running the game on the “Fantastic” setting @ 1920 x 1080 and I maintain around 60 fps; your mileage may vary. The sound is acceptable, although several recording loops can be heard within the engine noises and the background ambients. In my opinion, the game feels a bit unfinished, and could definitely benefit from more "tweaking" work. 

One of my early frustrations with this game, was getting the controls on an Xbox One controller all sorted out. Specifically the thumbsticks which control driving and camera movement. You can change the axis settings via the configuration pop-up before starting the game and this helps. After I made a few minor tweaks, I really began to enjoy it more. 

All in all, it was quite fun cruising around ferrying passengers, and all the while building up my water taxi/property tycoon business within the given tropical setting of the Jo Jo Islands. I would recommend this game and I do think it’s reasonably priced for what it is. I say pick it up if you’re looking for a simple, relaxing, no brainer-time killer!

For the sake of rating the game with numbers...I give it a 2 / 5!

Recommended +0 for "it could be better"

author: {'steamid': '76561197971316390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1416956356}
review:
The Good Life description says that this is a game about building a "commercial empire" while becoming "rich and famous". However in reality, the game is so shallow that these descriptions are bordering on false advertising and misrepresentation. I'll briefly explain how the description provided is just barely met by the reality of what the game actually gives you.

Do you build a commercial empire? Well, you do have a box that pops up occasionally to allow you to buy property. But that is the end of it, no further interaction from the player. I wouldn't call it management at all since you cannot even set a charge for renting these properties or influence them at all. What these do is function as bonus cash after you taxi clients from port to port. This brings me nicely onto the boating business aspect. 

When someone says the game is about running a business, there are some key elements required for that to really apply. Budgets, marketing, customer relations and employee relations are the core things which come to mind.  Well, The Good Life does require you work to a budget but everything else is absent. You apparently have employees because boats you own, but don't personally use, generate income like your other investments. But again, you don't actually influence any of that. Essentially your 'empire' consists of you personally picking up customers and taking them from A to B. Now this wouldn't really be too bad since games like Crazy Taxi actually made this kind of thing enjoyable but sailing empty waters in largely straight lines gets dull very fast and the highlight of the journey is the challenge of docking the boat without damaging it. One of the biggest mistakes the developers made is to give you the slowest boat in the game at the start and not explain that they can instantly buy a speed-boat instead. The developers should have simply provided the speed boat right away to avoid frustrating players.

The description also says that this has exploration, treasure hunting and other activities. Well, since you cannot ever leave your boat the exploration is limited to looking at islands from the coast and while the diving sections do allow you to very slowly move around freely, there is only 1 small map which is used for every diving mini-game. There is fishing, but it is a mini-game that just generates some more cash and isn't profitable or serve any purpose in the larger scope of the game. There isn't any complexity to fishing other than pushing the up and down arrows keys to reel the line in or loosen it to stop the line from breaking. There are other trivial events which happen at random as well. Such as tossing life-preservers to rescue people in the water, the occasional pirate speed-boat for you to avoid and the laughable 'tornadoes' which appear from time to time. But none of these are very interesting.

I can honestly say that while The Good Life sounds good on paper; what it gives you is a shadow of what it promises. Paying money for this game would be a big mistake even if it was on sale due to the limited entertainment value and what basically boils down to as leveling system where you invest time and energy to just see your bank balance grow. It lacks personality, a sense of progression or achievement and it just barely manages to even qualify as a game at all, due to how shallow the content is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970537749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1544, 'last_played': 1511714623}
review:
Why don't "they" make more games like this? I really like this game a lot! 

Basically, this is a game about moving to the tropics and taking over a small boat transportation enterprise. You spend most your time transporting people from island to island (for a fee), while acquiring the money to help build your tourist industry empire (via bidding on properties that pay rent). There are also missions that have you skin diving to collect treasure and find downed vintage helicopters, etc... You also have the opportunity to fish (which I have yet to get the full hang of). As you gain money and property, you also gain reputation. And yes, you can buy different boats and so on as you increase your funds (and it is all fairly open ended). The game apparently ends when (you go broke or) you drive all of your competitors out of business. Haven't got to that point yet...  :)

The game takes a little getting used to as far as the controls, but its smooth sailing (sorry) once you do. There are some minor issues that the developer is on top of and he has already released a patch addressing some of them and adding improvements (literally acknowledging the individual players who suggested them). He is very engaged on the "discussions" board and obviously, is very open to those of us who have made suggestions. THIS is the kind of communication that you hope for from a developer! 

I'm really excited about the possibilities that might be included and the tweaks that will be made. Because this game is really fun to me .... And I believe it can be even more fun as its further refined. If the game is not going to be undated further, I would love to see a "The Good Life 2."

review:
I reviewed the game a year and a half ago while it was on Desura and for the most part had a positive experience.  However, there are some glaring flaws that I'm sorry to say haven't been fixed.  

*There are no audio sliders in the option menu.  Granted, this can be worked around by using your desktop's audio mixer, but you really shouldn't have to.  

*At present, there are certain situations in which the "save" button will not appear when you hit "esc" to view the in-game menu.  This can be a bit inconvenient for when you need to leave in a hurry.

*I like the addition of the new red quest line telling you where to go on your map, though for whatever reason it displays a line from the last port I've been to rather than the current port to which I'm currently docked.  It's worth noting that this only happens before you accept the quest (when you check to see where the destination port is on your map) - 11/30/14 Update: This appears to have been fixed.

*Safari and photo missions tend to pop up at the worst times (like when on a timed ferry mission) and skipping it so as to deliver the person on time will actually penalize you.

*On the plus side, new fishing missions have been added though reeling in a fish takes some getting used to.  The water effects are superb but the rest of it (character & cloud models, etc.) could use work.  

For now, the game is simply "good" for the asking price, though it could have been better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976032241', 'num_games_owned': 1202, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1417558257}
review:
I really wanted to like this game. It's a budget title so I went in with what I think are fair expectations. The problems are fixable so I'll start with the good, end with the bad. Maybe they'll get fixed! Edit: The developers have noted that they're working on some of the negatives in my reveiw. This game is NOT shovelware, it's just rough. It's November now, if you're reading this review a few months from now, check the forums to see if my concerns have been fixed. Edit2: Pirate issues have been addressed. I can safely give this game a thumbs up. It's ROUGH, but still good if you like this kind of game.

The graphics are a mixed bag, the models for people are so bad, but it's not really a big deal because the game is about boats, water and scenery. I think they did a pretty good job on that although there is definitely some improvement with weather effects.

I really liked the physics for waves. You can't just point your boat in a direction and go, you've got to be active on the helm like in a real boat.

The controls for everything except steering your boat are awful. Trying to aim when throwing life rings is nauseating. Trying to use the diving controls is a nightmare, fishing is confusing and unfun even once you know what you're supposed to do.

The random event generator is unbalanced, a random Hurricane is awesome. Two in a row is dumb.
Pirates, at least early in the game are a death sentence. I got two pirate events in a row before giving up on this game.

Edit!!: Boat Damage has been addressed and fixed---
Boat damage is economically crippling. A trip taking about 10 minutes might pay for 10% of your ship's damage. A single crash can cause that much, pirates might cause 50% damage. Damage also slows you down so good luck earning your way back to 100% health after a pirate hits you.

Edited on 25 Nov 2014: Made a note that the developer has acknowledged some of these problems.
Edit: 26 Nov 2014: Repair damage has been rebalanced and pirate areas are now marked. This was the thing that made me feel like the game was unplayable. The other issues are still being worked on.

review:
“The Good Life” immediately caught my attention since I like management games. It gives me a sense of satisfaction since I’m no business man. This is a close as I’ll get. To start off the graphics looks terrible when you’re still in the city. That’s acceptable though since the game will not be played in the city. Arriving on the island the graphics immediately got better. There is room for improvement though, e.g. if you look at the edges of the water and the beach – it just doesn’t look “real”.
What I like is the idea of purchasing real estate apart from running a boat company (really is that what its called? Nice uncle :( ). Although I’ve not had time to really play this game very long the first thing that really annoyed me, was trying to dock the boat. Sure I understand that realism is important but damn, I’m where I’m supposed to be but just can not dock it. The water keeps moving the boat around. So maybe the controls needs some tweaking … or maybe practise makes perfect.
But in general I think this game is worth the sale price and even the full price. I mean really, I’ve bought rubbish for between $14.99 - $19.99, that looked intriguing at first but turned out to be the biggest disappointment. So for $9.99, or for the current sale price, I will recommend it. I’m sure the bugs will be sorted out.

review:
Game: 8 / 10  -  Dev: 11 / 10

This game has so many activities, including: Boating, Fishing, Diving, Photography, Rescue, Real Estate Tycoon and Management!

Pros: DEV Support, Graphics, AI (Bids/Ranking System/In-Game Economy), Management, Many Varied Missions, Detailed Boats, Contols (Realism), Diving Scenarios and Map Size.

Cons: Fishing Scenarios (Weak), Real Estate Purchase System, Camera During Diving Scenarios is sometimes unresponsive, Pirate Zones (No Designated Area on Map to Avoid) and Repetitave Missions.

I really wasn't a fan of this game until about 2 hours of play.  I thought that it felt a little shallow.  Understand that the main point of this game is to gain REP to increase your income through bids, and ultimately purchase all of the real estate to run the AI out of business due to bankruptcy.  After a couple of hours of getting the hang of it, this has become a suprisingly good game.

Synopsis:  The cons aren't enough to take away from the strong features of the game.  If you're a fan of simulation/management games, then you must pick this up!  The price is well worth it, even at full $10USD retail.  Also, the DEV is awesome.  He really listened to the community through forums and quickly fixed a lot of the main issues quickly.  I don't think other DEVs put this kind of work in on a Sunday to please the gamers.  Cheers!

BUY IT!

review:
So fun game so far, slow casual pace with plenty to do. Appears to be a lot to do in order to reach the end.
Controls are fine once your used to them and basics are explained well in the tutorial.
Visuals are nothing spectacular but are plesant to look at and have found no ingame bugs in my 2hrs of play.
Only bug so far is unlocking achievements before you do them.
The tycoon part of the game is a very simplified property buying process that only involves money management 
as to whens the best time to buy. The end game does involve owning all property though so is a nice incentive to pay attention. The reputation part is an important aspect because when you bid on jobs and property you need to pay attention to who else is bidding cause someone with a much higher rep than yours will drive the price up making it tougher to be profitable. Like that part.
So if your looking for a casual way to spend your time yet stay engaged this game is a good buy for the price.
